description: Font rendering is far better than Remmina from linux to windows with HDP
summary: Best RDP client so far from Linux to Windows

description: Fast and reliable

Very fast, nice interface all options I need. 
However, I had issues with hotkeys that are not redirected to the remote hosts. Support was answering very fast and told me that will be fixed in the next version.
summary: Awesome RDP client, feels like a native Linux mstsc version

description: Great app with simillar feel like native windows RDP client. Supports multi monitor setup.
works as expected

As of 2021/10, this is the only app that supports proper HiDPI scaling. Remmina does client side scaling and it's very blurry.

Title bar is broken, but whatever.
summary: The only choice as of now if you need proper HiDPI scaling

description: Only client I downloaded that basically worked out of the box with no hassle and endless configs to look up. Tried many RDP clients, if you need a fast solution, try this.
I tried so much to open a .rdp file wirh remmina and I can't, but with this program I did it easyly. It have some bugs but works.

Passes through devices like webcams with ease. No other program does this besides FreeRDP itself or Reminna, but they require a lot of tinkering to do so. The dev's are also very responsive to bug reports, please please please report bugs to the email on the website if you encounter them. Its the best way to make things better

finally a working RDP solution for my KDE Neon installation. 
The interface layout and logic being close to Windows' is a big plus, less hassle.
Title says it all, this works very well on the steam deck with a mouse and keyboard.
Worked first try
Connected no problem to my server19 box. Fantastic!
After a whole morning looking for a decent RDP server, by just working is an automatic 5-star for me. No other clients work on Steam Deck (At least that I've tried).
I tried, compiled, modified, hated many rdp clients in years. Never found a usable one until now! This one seems did it.
Easy to setup, and easy to use.
I could connect to a Ubuntu System
Best RDP clent I have come across, easy to use.

I tried Remmina; I could not connect through it. I wasted time. 

So I tried ThinCastRemote Desktop Client. It just works!
Appears to be a fork of the discontinued itopia version.

Great simple software that works perfectly for RDPing to a windows machine from a raspberry pi4b running Fedora 39. There are a few settings to change for optimal performance but otherwise a very nice and functional app.
summary: works perfectly on pi4b to windows

description:
Tried a Number of Apps on Flathub....
They didn't work....Black Screens and Debug Logs.

Then found ThinCast Client, and it just works out of the Box without any Issues on the Latest Fedora Silverblue.
summary: Works Great on Fedora Silverblue 39 on Wayland!

description:
I love this RDP client. It just works - every time, and I can leave it connected for days on end. The built in Gnome Connections app is buggy and tends to disconnect, while this gem does everything you need it to do - connect and STAY connected.

Thank you devs.
It works when opening and connecting, but after entering remote server credentials, the app just closes itself without any error.
Works like a charm and was easy to install and get working. Similar to plug and play.
summary: Best Remote Desktop I Could Find

description: No option to change default port. 0 stars, unusable.

He probado varias opciones para relizar conexión remota y este ha sido el mejor programa por mucho, configuración intuitiva si se viene de windows, buena calidad y trabaja sin problema con 2 pantallas, exelente.
Fácil de usar rapido de configurar y una buena alternativa para xrdp
Fonctionne parfaitement pour un usage professionnel, qualité et latences proches du client Microsoft officiel.
summary: Le meilleur client RDP sous Linux

description: Very simple and useful. More like Remmina.
Была проблема подключения к корпоративной сети ... эта программа очень помогла!
I really like that this application is very similar to the native application from Microsoft. Work comfortably and there is support for multiscreen!

It works well, relatively to other Linux RDP clients, at least it has clipboard working, including copying files. The only problem i have, that i cannot have more than one simultaneous connection: window does not appear when i make a second connection.
